intro: Aylostera oculata, commonly known as the eye-leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, large, heart-shaped leaves with a prominent central vein that resembles an eye. Its flowers are typically pink or white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Aylostera oculata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and delicate blooms.
